tool.name: buildFGDB

param.name: inputFolder
param.displayname: Tabular Folder of Exported SSURGO Textfiles
param.dialogReference: This is the "tabular" folder with the 68 text files exported from NASIS. Typically exported by State Soil Scientist of the state-wide raster soil survey area.

param.name: raster_p
param.dialogReference:
This is the raster to be imported into the RSS database that meets the standards in part 648 of the NSSH. It needs an MUKEY field as a string. The populated values should be equivalent to the integer values.

  • This raster will be renamed MURASTER_10m_<State abbreviation>

  • It will be projected if it is not NAD83 / Conus Albers (EPSG: 5070) projection

  • It will be resampled if not 10m cell size using Nearest Neighbor if cell size is not 10 m, if raster needs to be snapped, or projected

  • It will be aligned (snap raster) to the gSSURGO raster

  • It will have a 32-bit unsigned data type

param.name: out_p
param.dialogReference: The location where the RSS dataset and exported SSURGO folder structure will be saved.

param.name: state
param.expression: AK | AL | AR | AS | AZ | CA | CO | CT | DC | DE | FL | GA | GU | HI | IA | ID | IL | IN | KS | KY | LA | MA | MD | ME | MI | MN | MO | MP | MS | MT | NC | ND | NE | NH | NJ | NM | NV | NY | OH | OK | OR | PA | PR | RI | SC | SD | TN | TX | UT | VA | VI | VT | WA | WI | WV | WY
param.dialogReference: Select the state abbreviation of the dataset

param.name: fy
param.dialogReference:
The fiscal year of publication. If being done during the typical annual soil refresh cycle in September/October, the fiscal year of publication is the coming or starting fiscal year.

Example, if it is October 2024 then the fiscal year of publication is 2025

tool.summary: This tool creates a Raster Soil Survey (RSS) database as a File Geodatabase with a gSSURGO template (relational database) and as a SSURGO Download Folder
tool.usage:
This toolset is a three tools in one from the original ArcMap Desktop version, 1) Create RSS DB by Map; 2) Import Raster to RSS db; 3) Open Source Export

This tool imports the text files and the raster into the file geodatabase with relationship classes and indices defined.

The raster is imported and named MURASTER_10m_<State abbreviation>_<fy>.

It then creates a SSURGO Download file structure with the tabular text files and exports the raster from the File Geodatabase as a GeoTIFF into the spatial directory.
